world is think of it as like an add-on board and what this does is it offloads
the signaling of the where the servos need to go and what they need to do for
the the simple robot off the Raspberry Pi and the Linux kernel and onto this
dedicated board and it's super useful because it comes with its own SDK so it
makes it very easy to send signals like hey you know go to this location or that
location versus having to do kind of low-level what's called pulse width modulation
it also offloads the power requirement so instead of powering the the servos
from the Raspberry Pi which can cause you know a power drain on the PI you
plug in your your own separate power to this hat so then you can have you can control 16 servos
with this one hat and then you can stack a whole bunch of these on top and from literally from a single Raspberry Pi you
